intro: Carlemannia congesta, commonly known as the clustered carlemannia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenia. The plant is characterized by its dense clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom throughout the year. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a glossy surface, while the stems are often hairy. Carlemannia congesta is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as undergrowth in rainforests.
